results.title: The Nutcracker (The Ballet)
results.brief_description: Mikhail Baryshnikov debuts his choreographic talent as well as dancing prowess in this timeless Hoffmann fairytale ballet. Performed by the American Ballet theatre to the classic Tschaikovsky score, “The Nutcracker” features Gelsey Kirkland as the young girl Clara, Baryshnikov as the Prince and Alexander Minz as Drosselmeyer, Clara’s godfather who conjures up an end to her dream. With the National Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Kenneth Schermerhorn.

results.title: The Nutcracker
results.brief_description: Maree, a poor servant girl, helps Prince Nathaniel overcome an evil spell which has turned him into a toy nutcracker and frozen his kingdom in time. Hoffmann’s tale is set to Tschaikovsky’s music.

results.title: The Nutcracker
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, National Video Corporation, Peter Wright and John Vernon
results.brief_description: The Royal Ballet at the Royal Opera House Covent Garden presents this beautiful magical production by Peter Wright of the classic fairytale “The Nutcracker” by E.T.A. Hoffmann, with music by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky performed by the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House Covent Garden, conducted by Gennady Rozhdestvensky, and choreography by Lev Ivanov and Peter Wright. Two of the Royal Ballet’s leading principals, Lesley Collier and Anthony Dowell appear as the Sugar Plum Fairy and her Prince, supported by Michael Coleman (Herr Drosselmeyer), Julie Rose (Clara), Guy Niblett (the Nutcracker) and artists and students of the Royal Ballet Schools along with the London Oratory Junior Choir directed by Patrick Russill.

results.title: The Nuremberg Chronicle
results.creator_credit: Weslyan University, John Frazer and Russell T Limbach
results.brief_description: Explores the handsome woodcuts that illustrate the Nuremberg Chronicle - a history of the world published in 1493 - giving the account of history as it was known in 1493 from the Creation to the Final Judgement that was predicted to be coming soon. The film conveys something of people’s hopes, fears and beliefs at a time in history when old ways and ideas were changing radically.

results.title: The Nun's story
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: This story begins in 1930 with Sister Luke’s (Audrey Hepburn) journey from postulant to nun. Of her solemn vows of poverty, chastity, silence and obedience, Sister Luke knows the last will be the most difficult to achieve. Her strong will and intellectual pride, qualities destined to make her a brilliant nurse, threaten to undermine her holy calling. Unable to be obedient to her heart, Sister Luke comes perilously close to breaking. Highlighted by Audrey Hepburn’s performance, this film received eight Academy Award Nominations and also stars, Peter Finch, Dame Edith Evans, Dame Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.

results.title: The Nugget
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Macquarie Film Corporation, b j films, Bill Bennett and Jennifer Cluff
results.brief_description: Lotto, Wookie and Sue are three working class mates whose favourite pastime is to frolic in the outback on a futile hunt for gold, dodging the protestations of their spouses. One day however luck befalls the hapless trio when they happen upon a giant nugget of gold, making them instantly rich. Avarice soon takes over and former rock-solid friendships are torn asunder by rivalries and petty disagreements. Bill Bennett (Kiss or Kill, Spider and Rose) borrows from the set-up of John Huston’s “The Treasure of the Sierra Madre” (1948) but inverts the drama in favour of slapstick comedy, trading on Aussie movie cliches (redneck attitudes, colloquial banter, ockerism, boozing, mateship) familiar themes from such comedies as “The Castle”, “Welcome to Woop, Woop”, “Muriel’s wedding” and even “They’re a weird mob” to create an allegorical fable about the perils of wealth cast in a fun, lightweight, albeit highly predictable, manner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Macquarie Film Corporation, b j films, Bill Bennett and Jennifer Cluff

results.title: The Nuclear age
results.creator_credit: Central Independent Television (UK), WGBH (Boston), Nihon Hoso Kyokai and Julian Ware
results.brief_description: The Nuclear Age is a documentary series which provides a definitive account of the momentous events in the 40 year history of the nuclear arms race from the first atomic explosion to the signing of the INF Treaty.

results.title: The Novo Castrian story: an impression of the Port of Newcastle, Australia
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Maritime Services Board and Peter Whitchurch
results.brief_description: The port of Newcastle, N.S.W., its existing facilities and work on new wharf and reclamation developments. The life and major industries of the city and the Hunter Valley are shown briefly.

results.title: The Novel: early Victorian England and Charles Dickens
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Examines Victorian England, pointing out its startling contrasts of morality and hypocrisy, splendour and squalor, prosperity and poverty. Illustrates these points by enactments of episodes from Dickens’ novels.

results.title: The Novel and television
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Alasdair Clayre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The 19th Century Novel”.
A discussion on some of the differences between the novel in its television dramatised form and the original prose. The film uses the problems involved in dramatisation as a way of discussing the novels concerned. The novels dealt with are Cousin Bette and Great Expectations.
